title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

11:32 <+cjdelisle> I have some storage tests which test filesystem attachment storage but I don't know how to make tests execute multiple times with different configurations.  
11:33 <+cjdelisle> Absent any complaint I am going to commit this as-is and wait until someone gives me an idea for how to run tests multiple times under different configurations.

13:46 <qwebirc90386> has joined #xwiki  
13:46 <qwebirc90386> has quit  
13:46 <prapia> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <prapia> i am interested to discuss about gsoc. is this the right place?  
13:48 <+cjdelisle> what do you want to discuss?  
13:49 <+cjdelisle> You have an idea which will revolutionize the way people interact forever?  
13:53 <bark> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <bark> hi all :)  
13:53 <+cjdelisle> howdy  
13:55 <prapia> I dont have an idea as of now, but I am still researching on ideas mentioned in the website and mailing list archives. I am interested in 'auto completion in content editors''  
13:56 <+cjdelisle> I think the way it works is you write up a proposal and submit it to the gsoc page on xwiki.org  
13:56 <npm\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:56 <+cjdelisle> !search summer of code  
13:56 <bark> i just checking the project out. Se if i like the structure of it  
13:57 <prapia> ya i have done all that. I found very interested and very keen to work for XWiki, Where to post the proposal? How do I contact the mentor of that project?  
13:57 <+cjdelisle> If you have any questions about the system, I know far more than I rightfully should.  
13:58 <npm> has quit  
13:58 <+cjdelisle> I think it would be the student application form. Ofc I don't know that much about gsoc so I may well be feeding you a bunch of horse manure.  
13:59 <+cjdelisle> There are more developers around on week days so you might want to check back then.  
13:59 <bark> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/student+application+form  
14:01 <prapia> Hey thank you very much.  @cjdelisle  
14:03 <+cjdelisle> A suniite, I'm just over the hill here in western MA

20:17 <mayanks43> has quit  
20:18 <+cjdelisle> hmm I figured he was probably a decent user just confused about where to make pages, hence the comment.  
20:21 <mayanks43> has joined #xwiki  
20:22 <vmassol> cjdelisle: hmm seems the registration page of xwiki.org got broken with the new registration impl you did  
20:22 <vmassol> it used to display a big warning message  
20:22 <vmassol> explaining that you didn't need to register to test drive xwiki and was pointing to the playground  
20:23 <vmassol> it was also explaning when you needed to register a uer  
20:23 <vmassol> user  
20:23 <vmassol> I don't see it anymore on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/register/XWiki/Register  
20:23 <vmassol> and the message is wrong there: "This will allow you to edit pages, once the admin gives you appropriate rights" <— this is wrong  
20:24 <vmassol> how can we override this now? (I don't recall)  
20:25 <+cjdelisle> I seem to recall it was just an edit to XWiki.Registration  
20:26 <+cjdelisle> I also seem to recall we intended on making a change to the version that was distributed with XE but apparently I dropped the ball and now I can't remember what the correct wording was.  
20:26 <vmassol> cjdelisle: do you think you could fix the reg on xwiki.org to put back the info I mentioned? If you're busy I'll do it but later on (need to take care of my kids now)  
20:27 <+cjdelisle> I'll look and see if what it said is somewhere. Were we planning on changing the wording in the one distributed in XE?  
20:27 <vmassol> yes definitely, I didn't know it was wrong  
20:28 <+cjdelisle> If so I will make a note to bring it up on monday so we can decide on the wording and I can hopefully actually commit it this time.  
20:28 <vmassol> it's very simple to change  
20:28 <+cjdelisle> Well it would be a change to applicationResources.propseries (if we are to distribute something different with XE)  
20:30 <+cjdelisle> done. It was just a rollback  
20:30 <+cjdelisle> (x.org)  
20:31 <vmassol> cool  
20:31 <vmassol> I'll update it now the view source is in the menu  
20:31 <vmassol> what page is it?  
20:31 <vmassol> found it  
20:32 <+cjdelisle> Were we planning on rewording the default registration page?  
20:32 <+cjdelisle> Maybe I didn't understand properly or just imagined it.  
20:35 <vmassol> done  
20:35 <vmassol> I don't know but we should reword it  
20:35 <+cjdelisle> Ok. making a note to bring it up next week.  
20:37 <vmassol> cool to see xwiki.org and myxwiki.org in good shape :)  
20:38 <vmassol> ok need to fix the build breakages I introduced in distribution-tests  
20:41 <+cjdelisle> I brought in the beginnings of some storage tests. Other than wiki start time they are fast. Still need your help getting them to run multiple times with different configuration parameters. My usual method (just read the code) breaks down when working with junit and maven.  
20:41 <vmassol> yes hadn't time to look at it  
20:41 <vmassol> trying to fix the build I broke before the monday release  
21:17 <vmassol> has quit  
21:19 <sburjan`> has quit  
21:36 <supreet> has quit  
21:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
21:47 <vmassol> lots of stuff in guice 3.0: http://code.google.com/p/google-guice/wiki/Guice30  
21:47 <vmassol> btw this reminds me that I need to find the time to explore generating jdiff reports for our releases  
21:52 <+cjdelisle> hmm todo bring in jsr330. That's common to both guice and jsr229 IIRC. Also there are a lot of places where we could use providers.  
21:58 <vmassol> re jsr330 we"ve voted to use it, just need some time to do it  
22:02 <+cjdelisle> IMO just bringing in the dependency is a good start. Also maybe I can find some time to patch ECM to accept @Inject as an alternative to @Requirement then we can start making new code which is at least nearly complient.  
22:03 <+cjdelisle> oh well, bed time for me  
22:12 <vmassol> nn
